data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text:
I wasn't expecting much. It's small, it's downtown Worcester, not a Mecca for dining.

We ordered sashimi, shumai, edamame. The shumai were indifferent, the sauce had a nice spark. The white tuna, Saba and unagi were good. The service was leisurely, but pleasant. Will definitely go again. Will also try their delivery.

data.title: Protect your health & Save your money - Don't Go!
data.text:
Poor quality sushi.  
  I wouldn't go again as I don't want to get sick from the poor quality fish.  I'm also not sure how well they handle/maintain the fish based on what I saw in the display case and the saba that I was served.
  Proves again my rule: if they are not Japanese, it just won't be good.

data.title: Slow service for terrible sushi
data.text:
We went to Oishi because it was close to the hotel we stayed at and my son wanted to eat sushi for dinner. We got there and there was a family at another table already.
There were only 2 people behind the counter. We were seated immediately but then we waited some time before someone came to take the orders from the other family and then someone else came to take our order. We ordered chirashi, #6 maki sushi, unadon, a couple of salmon rolls. We waited some more before the salads came. 

We noticed they were very short on staff.  Just 2 people waiting the tables/taking orders and making the food.  Although they were very nice, the service was horrendously slow. 

The portions were pretty small including the salads.  The chirashi came with a few slices of fish on top of a thin bed of rice on a small plate. The unadon usually comes with hot rice - not sushi rice - and with some turnips.  The #6 maki rolls were ok as were the salmon rolls. The miso soup was too salty - there was a lump of miso paste at the bottom of the bowl so it seems like one bowl of soup was made for the order instead of scooping it out of a previously made pot of soup. For the amount of food given the prices were not cheap either.

The green tea was made with tea bags and my husband said the tea was the best thing we ate all night.

We've eaten so much better sushi in other places.

data.title: Great Lunch!
data.text: We just stopped in for lunch as we work downtown and have walked by this place many times.  Super impressed!  My boyfriend got the chicken teriyaki lunch special with a Japanese egg roll and miso soup. I got a bento box with a drink, spicy crab roll and chicken tempura roll.  The food was really good. ALL of the vegetables were so fresh too. The dining room was very clean and the service was really friendly. We will definitely be back.
